required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitors and Incident Respiratory Infections, Are They Harmful or Protective?
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitors and Incident Respiratory Infections, Are They Harmful or Protective? An Analysis Using UK Based Electronic Health Records of 5.6 Million Individuals.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study use UK based linked electronic health records from the Clinical Research Datalink
      (CALIBER) of 5.6 million individuals to conduct a matched case-control study to investigate
      the incidence of influenza in individuals prescribed ACEI compared to those not prescribed
      ACEI.

clinical_study.condition: Covid-19, Coronavirus, Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitors, Influenza, Electronic Health Records, Epidemiology, Comorbidity, Incidence, United Kingdom

arm_group.description: Individuals with an ACEI prescription in the study population.
Individuals without an ACEI prescription, and matched to the users by sex and 10-year age categories.

study_pop.textblock:
The nested case-control study include cases who had an ACEI prescription during study
        follow-up. We randomly select one control per case from the study cohort of individuals
        without any documented ACEI use. Controls are matched to incident AF patients according to
        sex, age (10-year age strata).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  We identify individuals aged 18 years or older and registered in the current primary
             care practice for at least one year.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  We exclude individuals with a prior history of influenza and viral pneumonia before
             study entry.
